channel.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: The Great Awokening ft. Josh Daws [Open Mike with Michael Thiessen]
item.description:
OPEN MIKE w/Michael Thiessen ~ June 14, 2024
On this episode of Open Mike with Michael Thiessen, Dr. Thiessen sits down with writer and podcaster Josh Daws to explore the concept of 'wokeness' in churches across North America. It delves into the definition of wokeness and how it has evolved from an awareness of systemic injustice to encompassing the Marxist ideas undergirding Critical Race Theory.

The discussion highlights the shift from biblical justice to a needs-based view of justice and the dangers of redefining terms like justice and oppression. It also touches on the impact of critical theory on the church, the focus on social justice over preaching the gospel, and the division created by constantly defining new oppressed groups. Concrete examples are given, including the MLK 50 event and the push for 'kingdom diversity' in churches. The conversation explores the importance of charity and the divide among Christian leaders. They discuss the need to distinguish between those pushing harmful agendas and those who are hurting and in need of care. They also touch on the cultural shifts and the challenges faced by the church in the current climate. The conversation concludes with a discussion on Twitter algorithms and the future of dialogue.

item.title: Taking the Marx Out of Marketing ft. Craig Klein of Sales Nexus [Open Mike with Michael Thiessen]
item.description:
OPEN MIKE w/Michael Thiessen ~ June 07, 2024
On this episode of Open Mike, Dr. Thiessen is joined by Craig Klein, CEO/President of SalesNexus. Their conversation covers the topics of censorship, cancel culture, and the impact on conservative voices in the business world. It delves into the challenges faced by organizations in reaching their audience and the role of technology platforms in censoring content. The discussion also explores the intersection of business and Christian values and the need for a more transparent and ethical approach to content moderation. The conversation delves into the impact of the Christian worldview on business, the issue of censorship, and the importance of localism and technological expertise in navigating big tech challenges. It emphasizes the need for intentional support of Christian businesses and the protection of data and messaging integrity.
